title: Laurie Sheddan Harvey joins F.E.E.D TX group -

The Tiger Cried cocktail at upcoming Sanctuari: ginger beer with Fernet, Chartreuse, Thai chile, coconut and a splash of Topo Chico and tiger "stripes" of balsamic infused with cocoa nibs. Photo: Alison Cook Image 17 of 18 Leslie Ross at the upcoming Sanctuari bar at Triniti restaurant. Leslie Ross at the upcoming Sanctuari bar at Triniti restaurant. Photo: Courtesy Photo Image 18 of 18 Laurie Sheddan Harvey joins F.E.E.D TX group 1 / 18 Back to Gallery One of Houston's most creative bartenders has found a new home to practice her art of the cocktail.
Laurie Sheddan Harvey, formerly of Sanctuari bar at Triniti restaurant, will be joining the F.E.E.D TX restaurant group managing the cocktail, beer and wine programs for BRC Gastropub , Liberty Kitchen & Oyster Bar and Liberty Kitchen & Oysterette . F.E.E.D TX also recently opened a Liberty Kitchen in Austin.
"I am beyond excited to work with such a successful and rapidly growing restaurant group," Harvey said Tuesday. "It really is a dream job for me. It gives me a much larger platform to spread my love of cocktails and hospitality."
She starts her new position today.
Last month Harvey and her husband Robert Harvey announced they were leaving Triniti. Robert Harvey, the restaurant's general manager, left to become the general manager at the new 8 Row Flint, the Ryan Pera and Morgan Weber project opening soon in the Heights.
Sanctuari opened on Nov. 7 of last year. Before joining Triniti, Laurie Sheddan Harvey spent time behind the bars at Dolce Vita, Beaver's, Haven and Philippe.
